edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.assignment2.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a GameEngine, which passes or returns data to other classes or method to represent game state.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEngine()
      This is the constructor for the class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assignPlayerWeapon(int choice)
      This method takes an integer and assigns a Gun to Player based on the integer's value.
      boolean battleMode()
      This method checks if the enemy has been created and also checks which of the two ActiveAgents dies.
      void checkWeaponEmptiness()
      This method does a check on both the Guns of Player and Enemy.
      boolean encounterOccurred()
      This method gathers the value on top of the encounterChances list indexed at position and returns it.
      boolean escapeEnemy()
      This method attempts to let the Player escape from the enemy through a randomly generated number from 0-9.
      java.lang.String[] getDungeon()
      This method simply returns the String array that represents the dungeon
      Enemy getEnemy()
      This method simply returns the instance of Enemy.
      java.lang.String getEnemyAmmo()
      This method returns the String ratio of ammo to maxAmmo of Enemy's Gun.
      int getEnemyHP()
      This method simply returns the amount of hitPoints Enemy currently has.
      java.lang.String getEnemyWeapon()
      This method returns a String representation of the Gun type that Enemy currently holds.
      Player getPlayer()
      This method simply returns the instance of Player.
      java.lang.String getPlayerAmmo()
      This method simply returns the ratio of Player's Gun ammo to maxAmmo.
      int getPlayerHP()
      This method simply returns the amount of hitPoints that Player has.
      java.lang.String getPlayerWeapon()
      This method simply returns the type of Gun that Player currently holds.
      void initiateBattle()
      This method sets battle to true and creates/recreates the Enemy.
      void movePlayer()
      This method simply changes the position of Player to one forward.
      void setEncounterChances()
      This method fills the encounterChances list with boolean values that represents encounter or no encounter and shuffles it three times.
      void simulateEnemyAttack()
      This method attempts to simulate the Enemy attack by calling the Enemy method ActiveAgent.shoot(ActiveAgent).
      void spawnEnemy()
      This method either creates or recreates the Enemy and assigns or reassigns it an Item.
      boolean stillInDungeon()
      This method simply returns whether or not the Player is position at the exit.
      void terminateEnemy()
      This method nullifies the Enemy.

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        This is the constructor for the class. It initializes all fields above.

    • Method Detail

      • setEncounterChances

        public void setEncounterChances()
        This method fills the encounterChances list with boolean values that represents encounter or no encounter and shuffles it three times.

      • assignPlayerWeapon

        public void assignPlayerWeapon(int choice)
        This method takes an integer and assigns a Gun to Player based on the integer's value.
        Parameters:
        choice - Integer representation of Gun choice.

      • stillInDungeon

        public boolean stillInDungeon()
        This method simply returns whether or not the Player is position at the exit.
        Returns:
        true if position is at the exit, false if anywhere else.

      • getDungeon

        public java.lang.String[] getDungeon()
        This method simply returns the String array that represents the dungeon
        Returns:
        The String array representing dungeon

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer()
        This method simply returns the instance of Player.
        Returns:
        Instance of Player

      • getPlayerHP

        public int getPlayerHP()
        This method simply returns the amount of hitPoints that Player has.
        Returns:
        The Player's hitPoints.

      • getPlayerWeapon

        public java.lang.String getPlayerWeapon()
        This method simply returns the type of Gun that Player currently holds.
        Returns:
        The type of Player's Gun.

      • getPlayerAmmo

        public java.lang.String getPlayerAmmo()
        This method simply returns the ratio of Player's Gun ammo to maxAmmo.
        Returns:
        String ratio of ammo to maxAmmo

      • getEnemy

        public Enemy getEnemy()
        This method simply returns the instance of Enemy.
        Returns:
        instance of Enemy

      • getEnemyHP

        public int getEnemyHP()
        This method simply returns the amount of hitPoints Enemy currently has.
        Returns:
        Enemy hitPoints.

      • getEnemyWeapon

        public java.lang.String getEnemyWeapon()
        This method returns a String representation of the Gun type that Enemy currently holds.
        Returns:
        Enemy's Gun type.

      • getEnemyAmmo

        public java.lang.String getEnemyAmmo()
        This method returns the String ratio of ammo to maxAmmo of Enemy's Gun.
        Returns:
        Enemy's Gun ammo to maxAmmo

      • escapeEnemy

        public boolean escapeEnemy()
        This method attempts to let the Player escape from the enemy through a randomly generated number from 0-9. Moves the Player back one as well if escape is successful.
        Returns:
        true if successful escape, false if failed.

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer()
        This method simply changes the position of Player to one forward.

      • encounterOccurred

        public boolean encounterOccurred()
        This method gathers the value on top of the encounterChances list indexed at position and returns it.
        Returns:
        true if "encounter occured", false if not.

      • initiateBattle

        public void initiateBattle()
        This method sets battle to true and creates/recreates the Enemy.

      • simulateEnemyAttack

        public void simulateEnemyAttack()
        This method attempts to simulate the Enemy attack by calling the Enemy method ActiveAgent.shoot(ActiveAgent).

      • checkWeaponEmptiness

        public void checkWeaponEmptiness()
        This method does a check on both the Guns of Player and Enemy. If both are empty, reload them both.

      • battleMode

        public boolean battleMode()
        This method checks if the enemy has been created and also checks which of the two ActiveAgents dies. If the Enemy dies, take the Item it drops and act upon its benefit based on its type.
        Returns:
        true if Player and Enemy are engaged in battle, false otherwise.

      • terminateEnemy

        public void terminateEnemy()
        This method nullifies the Enemy.

      • spawnEnemy

        public void spawnEnemy()
        This method either creates or recreates the Enemy and assigns or reassigns it an Item.
